The event is likely related to the ongoing fight between the Sinaloa Cartel factions of Los Mayitos and Los Chapitos gangs in the municipality of Culiacan that started on 9 September. 1 fatality.

According to witnesses, the clash initiated close to the local park and Cobaes school and extended along Sabinos street, Colonia Miguel Hidalgo and north of Ciudad Universitaria. Also in Culiacan Rosales, irons ('ponchallantas') were set on the bridge connecting Las Quintas and Isla Musala in Colonia La Campina and on Rolando Arjona and Emiliano Zapata boulevards, including on the bridge known as 'Pepsi's bridge' (likely used to set (narco) roadblocks). source: Diario Contra Poder en Chiapas; El Blog del Narco; El Diario.Mx; El Sol de Sinaloa; La Jornada; Milenio; Tiempo
notes: On 11 September 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, for the third day in a row, armed individuals from criminal groups clashed in different parts of the city. The armed men also shot at a urban vehicle and set it on fire to set a (narco) roadblock on the area of La Costerita, Obregon and Brarrancos. One person was killed and another two were injured. The event was recorded in video and shared on social media. Also, a man was shot and killed in Colonia 16 de Septiembre. This comes after an armed clash between armed groups was reported in Quila community (coded separately). According to the authorities, these events come amid a suspected war between the 'Chapitos' and 'Mayos' factions of the Sinaloa Cartel. The state authorities also announced that the official toll from the violence of the last three days is nine men killed, eight wounded by gunshots, 14 complaints of deprivation of liberty and 16 for car theft. 2 fatalities.

According to local sources, these armed clashes come amid a possible war between the 'Chapitos' and 'Mayos' factions of the Sinaloa Cartel. At least two armed men from Los Chapitos and Los Mayos were killed. 2 fatalities.

According to the authorities, these events come amid a possible war between the 'Chapitos' and 'Mayos' factions of the Sinaloa Cartel. Casualties unknown.

On 10 September 2024, in Cuatla, Morelos, police officers and two suspected extortionists clashed around the pantheon of Jardines del Recuerdo and Libramiento de Cuautla. The two suspects were arrested. There were no casualties.

On 10 September 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, armed individuals on vehicles clashed by pantheon San Martin, La Costerita bridge and along International Mexico 15 road, moving towards the south of the municipality. An alternative version indicates that there was no clash, but armed individuals shot into the air. Army officers chased the vehicles until the village of Los Arrayanes, where they clashed (coded separately). Also in Culiacan Rosales, armed individuals set (narco) roadblocks on Obregon bridge and near Splash club on Mexico 15 road. Also on Mexico 15 road, armed men shot at a vehicle that was in a gas station. Due to the unsecure situation in Culiacan (and also to damages on the runway not related to the violent events) authorities suspended operations in the International Airport of Culiacan. The event is likely related to the ongoing fight between the Sinaloa Cartel factions of Los Mayitos and Los Chapitos gangs in the municipality of Culiacan that started on 9 September (coded separately). On 10 September 2024, in Los Arrayanes, Sinaloa, armed individuals and army officers clashed, resulting in the dead of an officer. Officers also seized four vehicles (two of them armored) and weapons. The event is likely related to the ongoing fight between the Sinaloa Cartel factions of Los Mayitos and Los Chapitos gangs in the municipality of Culiacan that started on 9 September (coded separately) and a persecution that army officers initiated on Mexico 15 road (coded separately). 1 fatality.

Around 10 September 2024 (as reported), near Zacatecas, Zacatecas, gangs and army officers clashed on km. 63 of Zacatecas-Aguascalientes road, injuring a minor who was transferred to a hospital. It is not known if the injured is linked to the clash or a collateral victim. Army officers seized three fire arms and arrested a man, who affirmed that the armed individuals were driving three vans and conducting the abduction of a huachicolero at the time of the clash. The whereabouts of the abducted man are unknown.

source: El Heraldo de Chihuahua; El Universal (Mexico); La Prensa de Monclova; La Verdad; Tiempo
notes: Around 9 September 2024 (as reported), in El Mulato, Chihuahua, two people were killed and their bodies were found in front of a funeral home. The victims were killed during a clash between members of the Sinaloa Cartel and La Empresa Gang, armed wing of the Juarez cartel in amid at least two other clashes between gangs in the municipality (coded separately). 2 fatalities.
On 9 September 2024, near around Buenavista Tomatlan, Michoacan de Ocampo, a landmine suspectedly planted by gang members exploded when a man on a horse passed-by, injuring him.

On 9 September 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, two armed individuals on a motorbike shot at a police car on Lazaro Cardenas street by Bernardo Reyes avenue, in Colonia Nino Artillero (drive-by). The police officer fired back and initiated a persecution. The armed individuals abandoned the motorbike and ran away. Casualties unknown.

source: E-Consulta; El Siglo de Durango; La Verdad
notes: Around 9 September 2024 (between 8 - 9 September), near Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Puebla, a man was killed and his dismembered body was found together with a threatening message in and around a car on the parking lot of the Metropolitan Security Complex C5, by km. 3.5 of Periferico Ecologico road. The threatening message was signed by the 'Mencho Special Operations Group (GOEM)' of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel and suspectedly addressed to the security officers that work in the Complex C5. GOEM is suspectedly composed of former state police officers. According to security cameras' footage, two men parked the car, placed some of the human remains on the floor around the vehicle and set it on fire before leaving in another vehicle driven by a third person. The victim was a businessman that was abducted in Solesta, Puebla, on 8 September 2024 and who according to the authorities was also dedicated to illicit activities and the event is related to a dispute over the control of the territory. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Mexico (2018-); Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
source: Borderland Beat; Diario de Morelos; El Siglo de Durango; El Sol de Sinaloa; Imagen del Golfo; Infobae; Los Noticieristas; Milenio; MiMorelia; Noroeste; Reforma; Riodoce; Tabasco Hoy
notes: On 9 September 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, members of Los Mayitos gang and Los Chapitos gang started a clash during the early morning hours. It is suspected that the clash began after Los Mayitos' security chief ordered to fight Los Chapitos in response to the arrest of Sinaloa Cartel leader Ismael Mayo Zambada (coded separately). State, federal, and military police were deployed to prevent the clashes. In Colonia La Campina, armed individuals shot at army and state police officers who were patrolling. Some sources indicate that officers intervened when they were warned of a caravan of armed individuals in 40 vehicles driving around the city. During the day, clashes between armed individuals and officers expanded across the city (at least to the 9th Military Zone, Colonia Miguel Hidalgo, Sector Las Quintas, Agricultores Boulevard, and Park 87). On Manuel Estrada avenue, between Cristobal Colon street and Francisco I. Madero boulevard, several armed men shot and injured a man who died at the Hospital. On Agricultores Boulevard, Colonia Villa Satelite, a man was killed, and his body was thrown from a vehicle with his hands tied. Near Park 87, in Colonia Simon Bolivar, a man was killed and his body was found with 'tiro de gracia'. Vehicles were set on fire and used as (narco) roadblocks in the accesses to Culiacan on at least Mexico 15 road, Imala Road, Fraccionamiento Los Angeles, and La Primavera. During the clashes, an army officer was killed, at least three people were injured, and four were arrested. Additional clashes suspected to be linked to these events took place in the nearby towns of Costa Rica and Potrerillo del Norote (coded separately). Following the clashes, the army deployed around 1000 officers, reconnaissance aircraft, and helicopters to support the security deployment in Culiacan. Sources indicate that Ismael 'El Mayo' Zambada, the recently arrested leader of the Mayo Zambada faction of the Sinaloa Cartel, and his chief of security 'El Comanche', ordered the clashes to fight the faction of Los Chapitos. At least 4 fatalities.
On 9 September 2024, in Chemax, Yucatan, suspected gang members clashed on 21 street, between 24 and 26 streets, near the main square, resulting in one dead. 1 fatality.

source: El Heraldo de Chihuahua; El Universal (Mexico); La Prensa de Monclova; La Verdad; Tiempo

source: El Heraldo de Chihuahua; El Universal (Mexico); La Prensa de Monclova; La Verdad; Tiempo

Authorities later deployed at least 70 army officers to reinforce security in the area. 2 fatalities.

Some reports suggest that Los Viagras gang was also involved in the clash after announcing their alliance with the CJNG. The event was also extended to other locations in other states (coded separately). According to local reports. Two armed men were killed. However, this was not confirmed by the authorities. 2 fatalities.
On 8 July 2024, in Luis Moya, Zacatecas, during the early morning unidentified armed individuals shot at the municipal police station. There were no casualties.

notes: On 8 July 2024, in Cozumel, Quintana Roo, armed individuals in a vehicle shot and killed a man and a boy in a drive-by. A little girl was also injured. The man was the father of the boy and the girl was also inside the vehicle, although the relationship with the other victims is unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 7 July 2024, in El Guerreno, Tamaulipas, two armed individuals shot against military officers near the Reynosa-Pharr international bridge who repelled the attack. The two individuals died as a result, and weapons were seized as well as a vehicle. 2 fatalities.

The video was share on social media. 1 fatality.

notes: On 27 June 2024, in Celaya, Guanajuato, according to witnesses, six masked armed men entered a bar and shot at people inside a bar in la colonia Renacimiento. Three people were shot dead while another two died after being suffocated by molotov bomb thrown by the perpetrators. Another six people were injured. The perpetrators left a message and tried to set the place on fire. According to the investigations, the victims are members or linked to the Santa Rosa the Lima Cartel and the attack was perpetrated by the Jalisco New Generation Cartel. 5 fatalities.

On 27 June 2024, in Ciudad Apodaca, Nuevo Leon, several armed men from a criminal group travelling in a vehicle clashed with the municipal police around El Mezquital neighborhood. Two men were arrested. There were no casualties.

Around 26 June 2024 (as reported), in Cucuyulapa Cardenas, Tabasco, a man was killed and only the head was found inside a cooler with a message around Samaria bridge on Villahermosa-Cardenas highway. Later, a video was released were the victim was still alive and confessed to be a criminal and dedicated to robbery. 1 fatality.

On 26 June 2024, in the municipality of La Concordia, Chiapas, 20 men were killed and their bodies were found between San Nicolas and Reforma. The men were wearing tactical gear and were piled on top of each other. The victims are believed to be members of the CCYG: Chiapas and Guatemala Cartel and one of them had the 'tiro de gracia'. The attack is being linked to a clash between the Sinaloa Cartel and the CCYG: Chiapas and Guatemala Cartel. Some reports suggest that the Fuerzas Especiales de Avendano (FEA), an armed wing of the Los Chapitos, faction of the Sinaloa Cartel, was involved in the clash. The bodies were discovered in a truck on 30 June. 20 fatalities.

On 26 June 2024, in La Ruana, Michoacan de Ocampo, members of Los Viagras gang placed explosives on a bridge near the Chamy community and blew it up. These types of actions are in reaction to the operations carried out in the area and to hinder the passage of other groups with which they dispute the territory.

notes: On 23 May 2024, in San Jeronimo Palantla, Guerrero, for the second consecutive day, three hundred members of Nahua Indigenous militia from Nuevo Amanecer community of the CIPOG-EZ attacked the community of San Jeronimo Palantla and clashed with fifty armed individuals from the community. The members of the Nuevo Amanecer community were also affiliated with the CIPOEG-EZ Indigenous organization, who accuse the San Jeronimo community of having links with the Los Ardillos gang. The attack followed an attack by residents of San Jeronimo Palantla on Nuevo Amanecer on the same day. According to a representative of the CIPOG-EZ, the attack was a response to the inaction of the authorities in the face of the attacks being suffered by residents of Nuevo Amanecer by community members of San Jeronimo Palantla. During the two-day clashes three vehicles, three houses and a police station were set on fire. The clashes began on May 22 (coded separately) and ended on May 23. There were no casualties.

Armored vehicles (monster vehicles) were used, and the Sinaloa Cartel destroyed at least three. The CJNG and the Sinaloa Cartel also clashed in Frontera Comalapa (coded separately). It is also suspected that members of one of the gangs set fires to communities near the towns of Nuevo Morelia, San Francisco, Las Palmas, El Rosario, and Las Brisas, damaging hectares of land, including pastures and crop fields. Residents reported that they didn't have electricity, telephone, and transportation service due to the clashes. Inhabitants abandoned their homes due to the insecurity caused by the fight between the CJNG and the Sinaloa Cartel to control the area. A report from a local organization mentioned that civilians were in the middle of the clash and around 25 died as a result, claiming that the civilians had 'tiro de gracia' and were probable extrajudicial executions committed by members of the National Guard. Though President Lopez Obrador later claimed that this number was not confirmed. One member of the National Guard was injured. 25 fatalities.

source: El Norte; Infobae; La Silla Rota; Milenio; Reporte Maya
notes: On 31 March 2024, in Nuevo Paraiso, Chiapas, members of unidentified armed groups engaged in an armed clash and set fire to trucks and houses in a ranch belonging to a local leader suspected to be a member of the CJNG. Five bodies were found inside a house, as well as six motorcycles and fifteen vehicles burned. The number of victims remains unclear, as some sources mentioned more than 25 fatalities, but officials reports mentioned a total of ten fatalities in all the related events, and five in this specific one. Some sources mentioned that the clash was between the Sinaloa Cartel and the CJNG. There were reports of gunshots heard in the nearby communities of El Parral and Villacorzo though clashes were not confirmed.

Some of the abandoned and burned vehicles bore the acronym of the CCYG belonging tot the Chiapas and Guatemala Cartel. Later, members of the CCYG declared that there were at least 30 members of the Sinaloa Cartel killed and more than 10 vehicles destroyed. At least 30 fatalities

On 24 March 2024, in the municipality of Ajuchitlan del Progreso, Guerrero, according to Guerrero ejido commissioners for the third consecutive day, members of La Familia Michoacana Cartel launched drones attacks that caused the burning of houses, hills, and livestock pens. The attacks were intended to allow the cartel to gain control of the area by forcing people to leave by burning the areas where they kept their livestock. Drone strikes were carried out for at least 72 hours. Similar attacks occurred in the municipalities of Tecpan de Galeana, Petatlan, Coyuca del Catalan and San Miguel Totolapan (coded separately). In total, about 40 bombs were dropped in all municipalities over the three days and villagers were forced to leave their homes. Casualties unknown.

The armed clash occurred after the armed individuals tried to flee when the police noticed them. The officers chased them until La Piedad and the armed individuals shot against them and ran away. The vehicles and ammunitions were seized. There were no causalities.

On 24 March 2024, in Morelia, Michoacan de Ocampo, there was an armed clash between armed individuals aboard two different vehicles in colonia Sindurio (drive-by). One of them was injured and two were arrested.

On 24 March 2024, in the municipality of Petatlan (coded to La Finca), Guerrero, according to Guerrero ejido commissioners for the third consecutive day, members of La Familia Michoacana Cartel launched drone attacks against several communities that caused the burning of houses, hills, and livestock pens. The attacks were intended to allow the cartel to gain control of the area by forcing people to leave by burning the areas where they kept their livestock. Among the attacked communities are El Caracol, El Camaron, El Limon, El Anono, Casas Viejas, El Mameyal, and La Finca. Drone strikes were carried out for at least 72 hours. Similar attacks occurred in the municipalities of Tecpan de Galeana, Coyuca del Catalan, Ajuchitlan del Progreso and San Miguel Totolapan (coded separately). In total, about 40 bombs were dropped in all municipalities over the three days and villagers were forced to leave their homes. Casualties unknown.

On 21 March 2024, in Zamora de Hidalgo, Michoacan de Ocampo, armed individuals ambushed police officers when they were patrolling the area, they repelled the attack and one perpetrator died as a result while two officers were injured. 1 fatality, 2 injured.

On 18 March 2024, in Santa Maria Xonacatepec, Puebla, a man was killed by two armed men inside his business in la colonia Primero de Mayo. Small bags with drugs were found and it is suspected that the place was used to sell drugs. 1 fatality.

On 16 March 2024, in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon, two brothers were killed by unidentified armed men in Colonia Benito Juarez. Both victims were drug dealers. 2 fatalities.

notes: On 15 March 2024, in Higueras, Nuevo Leon, there was an armed clash between the state police and members of an organized crime group. One armed man was killed. Three police officers were injured. 1 fatality.

On 15 March 2024, in Arteaga municipality, Michoacan de Ocampo, five people were injured due to the accident and one more resulted injured from a shooting. There are two versions, one is that there was an armed clash between rival groups on the highway Siglo XXI around Puente Arroyo de Las Cruces. One of the vehicles shot at another vehicle in a drive-by and this one crashed. Another version, says it was an attack from one car to the other in a drive-by.

On 15 March 2024, in El Porvenir, Guerrero, members of La Familia Michoacana attacked the community with drones charged with explosive. The drones released explosive cylinders at an elementary school causing damage. According to locals, students had just left class. A house was also damaged. After the incident, soldiers arrived on site, leading to a clash as armed men targeted the soldiers with fire shots from heights in the locality.
On 14 March 2024, in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon, a man was killed by unidentified armed individuals who entered his house in Colonia La Huerta. The victim had drug dealing background records. 1 fatality.

On 14 March 2024, in Salamanca, Guanajuato, there was an armed clash between armed men and the municipal police after the armed men shot at the police in Colonia Villareal. Four police officers were injured. One died later at the hospital. Another two people were injured by stray bullets. 1 fatality.

On 13 March 2024, in Cancun, Quintana Roo, there was an armed clash between armed men in colonia irregular 'La Roca' in region 244 during a settling of accounts. A four year-old little girl was injured with a stray bullet.
On 13 March 2024, in Benito Juarez, Nuevo Leon, an armed man shot and injured a man in a house in Colonia La Trinidad. The house is known to be a drug dealing point.

There was an armed clash during which one officer was wounded, and the criminal was also injured and arrested. 2 injured.

On 12 March 2024, in Jaltenango, Chiapas, armed individuals abducted 12 police officers including the deputy chief. The whereabouts of the victims remain unknown. The information has not been corroborated by the corresponding authorities.

On 12 March 2024, in La Sangre Nueva, Sonora, members of two armed groups clashed and set on fire at least one vehicle. On 3 March 2024, in La Ruana, Michoacan, members from antagonistic armed groups clashed. Two men were injured by stray bullets. 2 injured.

On 1 March 2024, near El Naranjo de Chila, Michoacan, armed individuals ambushed soldiers of the army between El Aguaje and Naranjo de Chila communities. Authorities also discovered and dismantled a nearby camp that was used by a criminal group.

notes: On 15 July 2023, near Ejido Palo Blanco, Tamaulipas, a group of armed men in a convoy attacked officers from the State Guard and soldiers of the Mexican Army along the crossing of the Brecha 109 road and the Rio Bravo highway, near the city limits of Rio Bravo and Reynosa. The clash ended near the Los Potrillos and Cristo Vive ranches. Five armed men were killed while one solider was injured and taken to recover the Reynosa hospital, while dozens of armed men escaped into the country side. After the clash, police confiscated a truck that was previously reported stolen and various weapons and materials. 5 fatalities.

actor2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
notes: On 15 July 2023, in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, armed civilians in a black van attacked four officers of the State Guard in a patrol vehicle on Morelos boulevard and Sal Street, in the colonia Longoria. The patrol vehicle crashed as a result of the attack and the armed men fled the scene. Two police officers were killed while the other two were injured and were taken to the hospital by emergency services. 2 fatalities.

actor2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
notes: On 15 July 2023, in Tepetongo, Zacatecas, an unidentified gang clashed with officers of the preventative state police forces (PEP). One of the gang members was killed while no police officers were injures. The rest of the gang members fled the scene. 1 fatality.
On 14 July 2023, near Ejido Palo Blanco, Tamaulipas, there was an armed clash between members of criminal groups on the border between Reynosa and Rio Blanco. There were no casualties.

On 14 July 2023, in Morelia, Michoacan, an armed couple who had just participated in the killing of a lawyer (coded separately) were chased and attacked by armed men. The chase started after the armed couple tried to escape and boarded a bus. During the attack at least two people were injured, one was a woman who was taken to the hospital.

On 14 July 2023, in San Lorenzo Teotipilco, Puebla, there was an armed clash between the municipal police and armed men during a police control. The event occurred after the individuals did not wanted to stop during a checkpoint. One person was injured.

On 13 July 2023, in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, there was an armed clash between military officers and armed men after the armed individuals shot at the officers from a bridge and houses near by Colonia Americo Villarreal Guerra on the road to Anahuac. One military officer was injured and died later at the hospital. Another four people were also injured. 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
notes: On 13 July 2023, in Teocaltiche, Jalisco, there was an armed clash between the state police and armed individuals in the city center during a police patrol. Drugs and weapons were seized. There were no casualties.

On 13 July 2023, in Ciudad General Escobedo, Nuevo Leon, armed individuals in a vehicle shot at a house (drive-by) in colonia Fomerrey 9. Armed individuals who were inside the house repelled the attack. A woman was shot and killed with a stary bullet. A man was shot and injured. The house is known as a drug dealing point. 1 fatality.

On 13 July 2023, in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon, there was an armed clash between the municipal police and 12 criminal members travelling in three vehicles on Avenidas Plutarco Elias Calles. Three men and one woman were arrested, the woman was identified as a former police officer. According to witnesses, at least two of the detainees wore bulletproof vests with the acronym of the Cartel del Noreste (CDN). The men were looking to execute a police officer of the civil forces, but retreated without him being found. Casualties unknown.

On 12 July 2023, in Ziquitaro, Michoacan, there was an armed clash between the municipal police and two armed individuals. The armed men hid in a house that was later searched by the police and four bodies were found buried. There no casualties during the clash.

Around 12 July 2023 (as reported), in Escarcega, Campeche, a drug dealer was killed and his body was found wrapped in bags in Reforma Agraria. The event is mostly related to the fight between criminal groups. The victim was reported missing since 7 July. 1 fatality.

An armed man and a body guard were killed. Another body guard was also injured. 2 fatalities.

On 11 July 2023, in San Luis Rio Colorado, Sonora, members of rivel groups clashed, leaving three men dead. One fourth man was injured and fled the scene. He was later transported to the hospital. 3 fatalities, 1 injury.

Six people were killed and fifteen people were injured, including four police officers and civilians. Later, two people were arrested. 6 fatalities.

On 9 July 2023, in Mina, Nuevo Leon, armed men opened fire from a moving car at a police officer in Colonia El Barrial at KM 35 on the highway to Monclova (drive-by). The police office sought refuge in a neighboring house and was left uninjured. There were no casualties.

On 7 July 2023, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a group of armed individuals opened fire at people who were arriving at the Icacos beach in a boat. The group of people retaliated the aggression and a clash ensued in fraccionamiento Club Deportivo. One person was injured as a result. 1 injury.

On 7 July 2023, close to San Fernando, Tamaulipas, members of a criminal group in several vehicles opened fire (drive-by) at the Mexican army who retaliated the aggression on the Matamoros-San Fernando highway during a security patrol close to Ejido San German. Nine perpetrators were killed as a result. 9 fatalities.

On 7 July 2023, in Guadalcazar municipality, San Luis Potosi, unidentified armed men clashed and a person was killed. According to the report, one of the armed groups threw a grenade at a vehicle on the street during the clash. 1 fatality.
On 7 July 2023, in San Nicolas de Jassos, San Luis Potosi, two organized crime groups clashed, leaving three people dead inside a house in colonia San Miguel de Colina. 3 fatalities.

actor2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police

actor1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
notes: On 7 July 2023, in Oaxaca de Juarez, Oaxaca, two officers of the Oaxaca state police were shot at by five armed individuals while on patrol. They gave chase to the individuals - three men and two women - until they reached a house in Colonia Miguel Hidalgo, on Venustiano Carranza street. They arrested the five individuals and confiscated a car, two motorcycles, and various firearms of different calibers. There were no casualties.

On 7 July 2023, near Villaldama, Nueva Leon, an armed group opened fire on two municipal police officers in their car while they were patrolling the highway toward Colombia. The burned bodies of the officers were found past midnight on Saturday along kilometer 62 of the highway, on the city limits of Villaldama and Salinas Victoria. The one of the victim was the chief of the municipal police who was also the chief of the escorts of the Villaldama mayor. 2 fatalities.

actor2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police

actor1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard
notes: On 7 July 2023, in Atitalaquia, Hidalgo, officers from the National Guard clashed with around 30 Huachicoleros while they were inspecting a report in the Dendho neighborhood of a vehicle equipped with instruments to steal gas. actor2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard

On 6 July 2023, in Zacatecas, Zacatecas, municipal police officers chased armed individuals after they killed two people (coded separately) and engaged in an armed clash in Colonia Mineral. actor2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police

On 4 July 2023, in Teocaltiche, Jalisco, an armed clash occurred between two unidentified gangs. Once arriving at the scene, state police confiscated a car bomb and three vehicles that were left behind by the gangs. There were no casualties.

On 4 July 2023, in Tecate, Baja California, two mechanic workers were shot and killed by four armed men at the workshop facilities in Colonia Jardines del Rio. The perpetrators left a messages signed by the Jalisco New Generation Cartel. According to local sources, one of the victims was a member of the Sinaloa Cartel. 2 fatalities.

source: AFN - Tijuana; Entorno Informativo; Milenio; Tabasco Hoy; Tiempo
notes: Around 4 July 2023 (between 30 June - 8 July), in Ciudad Obregon, Sonora, three police officers - one of them a police commander - were killed, and their bodies were found in an empty lot around Rubi Street between Cuarzo and Coral, in Colonia Valle Verde on 8 July. The victims were kidnapped in Pueblo Yaqui, Cajeme, Sonora, on 30 June 2023 by unidentified armed men in various trucks. As a result of the abduction, 36 Cajame municipal officers resigned, expressing dissatisfaction with their salary, high insecurity, and insufficient equipment - they also cited the killing of three municipal police officers earlier in 2023. 3 fatalities.

On 4 July 2023, around Francisco Uh May, Quintana Roo, a municipal police officer was shot and killed and another two were injured during an ambush by unidentified armed individuals between Francisco Uh May and Manuel Antonio Ay communities. 1 fatality.

Around 3 July 2023 (between 2 - 4 July), in Los Divorciados, Quintana Roo, a military officer was kidnapped by unidentified individuals when he was on his way to Merida on 2 July. He was killed and his body was found with signs of torture, his hands tied up, and the 'tiro de gracia' on 4 July. The victim man had participated in an operation on 2 June 2, where a local leader of the Caborca cartel in the municipality of Bacalar was killed. It is unclear if the victim was off duty. 1 fatality.

notes: On 3 July 2023, in Cosautlan de Carvajal, Veracruz, at midnight armed men shot at the municipal police headquarters. The Municipal Police headquarters is located next to the municipal palace. According to reports, the attackers shouted threats against the commander and the Municipal President, whom they accused of being a traitor. Casualties unknown.

Around 3 July 2023 (as reported), in Amozoc de Mota municipality, Puebla, two people were killed and their bodies was found inside the trunk of a car near the former factory of Covadonga. One of the victims was a woman who was kidnapped after an attack on 23 June 2023 (coded separately) and police believe she was selling drugs. No more detail is provided by the source. 2 fatalities.
On 2 July 2023, in Las Tablas, Jalisco, there was an armed clash between criminal members wearing tactical vests. Five people were killed. 5 fatalities.

On 2 July 2023, in Pitiquito, Sonora, an armed clash between two unidentified gangs occurred in Colonia La Granja over suspected drug-related activities. Once arriving at the scene, municipal police captured an abandoned vehicle containing ammunition for small and large firearms. Casualties unknown.

On 2 July 2023, in Caborca, Sonora, during the night there was a clash between criminal groups that occurred in Colonia El Alto, on Sanchez Burrola street and A street, over a suspected drug trade. Three people were killed and four people were injured. According to local sources, the clash is related to the recent arrest of a regional leader of Los Chapitos gang on 27 June (coded separately). Once arriving at the scene, elements from the Mexican Army recovered four large weapons, a stolen car, and tire punchers (poncha llantas) from the scene. 3 fatalities.

Around 2 July 2023 (as reported), in Zacatecas, Zacatecas, a member of the Sinaloa Cartel was killed and his body was found dismembered with a message signed by the Cartel del Noreste with threats against the Sinaloa Cartel. The event was recorded in video and shared on social media. 1 fatality.

On 1 July 2023, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, a man with known connections to drug trafficking was shot and killed by an armed man in Colonia Burocratas Municipales, at the intersection of Leopoldo Gonzalez Saenz street and Arturo B. de la Garza street. 1 fatality.

It is unknown if the clashes are related to each other. 2 fatalities.

On 29 June 2023, in Amozoc de Mota, Puebla, there was an armed clash between the state police and three members of Los Cheques gang after they kidnapped a woman in Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza (coded separately). notes: On 29 June 2023, in La Ruana, Michoacan de Ocampo, at least 25 members of Los Viagras gang travelling in two vehicles ambushed the former leader of the self-defense group of La Ruana community. The former leader and other four bodyguards who were state police officers were killed and their bodies were found inside vehicles that were set on fire. The armed individuals also burned vehicles and set a (narco) roadblock in different points of the community. The event was recorded in video by the residents and shared on social media. The former leader had already denounced an attack against him in the previous year and on the current year (coded separately). By 23 May 2024, 11 people had been arrested. 5 fatalities.

notes: On 15 June 2023, around Yosoyuxi Copala, Oaxaca, armed individuals shot at a vehicle travelling on the Santiago Juxtlahuaca- San Juan Copala highway around the area 'Cruz Chiquita'. In the vehicle, two ministerial police officers were travelling and guarding two catholic nuns who asked for protection to arrive to their mission in the area. One of the nuns was killed and the other injured, but she also died later at the hospital. According to the first reports, both female missionaries had requested the support of the Attorney General's Office because they had received death threats. The attack occurred on the area where there is a fight between Indigenous groups for political control of the Triqui region. The Unifying Movement of Triqui Struggle (MULT) accused its opponents, members of the Unifying Movement of Independent Triqui Struggle (MULTI), however, this accusation was not confirmed. Both groups identified with the Mixtec Indigenous group. 2 fatalities.

Around 12 June 2023 (between 11 - 12 June), in Tijuana, Baja California, seven men were killed and their bodies were found tortured inside a pick up truck. Police officers chased an individual and then stopped the driver to find one man wrapped in a blanket. Underneath wooden board and tires, another 6 bodies were found. There was gasoline in the truck and it assumed that the bodies would be set on fire. According to the investigations, the victims were relatives and at least two of them were involved in drug dealing. It is known that they were kidnapped one day before, according to relatives declarations. 7 fatalities.

notes: On 18 May 2023, in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, a camera captured the crash of a vehicle after a pursuit with military forces. The military officers violently forced five men out of the vehicle, beat them up, lined them up against a wall, and also found weapons in the vehicle. They are then seen shooting at unseen and distant targets before shooting and killing the five individuals that were in the vehicle. They were later recorded altering the crime scene and adding weapons next to the corpses. According to reports, the men were members of the CDN, although the information is not confirmed. The military officers were arrested on suspicion of having conducted an extrajudicial killing. 5 fatalities.

On 3 March 2023, in Heroica Matamoros, Tamaulipas, there was an armed clash between armed individuals in colonia Modelo. During the clash, at least five members of the Gulf Cartel kidnapped four US citizens. A woman who was a passer-by was killed with a stray bullet. On 5 March, two of the kidnapped victims were found dead and the other two alive in Ejido El Tecolote. Some versions suggest that the victims were tourists and were mistaken by members of a rival criminal group, while others suggest that the victims had criminal records related to drug production in the US. 3 fatalities.

Around 19 December 2022 (as reported), in San Javier, Chiapas, around 10-12 military officers were kidnapped by a group of armed individuals. The officers were held with their hands tied to their back, undressed and left only with their underwear. The armed individuals were asking for the return of six packages which had fallen from a plane and that were confiscated. According to the investigations, the packages were coming from South America and contained drugs. The event was recorded and shared on social media. The officers were released after 24 hours and the packages were returned to the armed individuals.

On 19 December 2022, in Ciudad de Ajalpan, Puebla, a man was shot and killed and a woman was injured by unidentified armed individuals who entered their house in colonia Centro. The victim was a drug dealer. The event could be a settling of accounts. 1 fatality.

Four men were killed. A vehicle was found set on fire. According to witnesses, the armed individuals were more than 30 men from La Gente Nueva gang and La Linea gang who were fighting. 4 fatalities.

At the same time, a riot broke out inside the penitentiary center in an attempted escape by prisoners. Two prison guards were injured in the attempted escape. Following the clash several (narco) roadblocks were set in different municipalities (coded separately).

Several others were injured. One of the victims was a little boy who was shot with a stray bullet. This clash is related to previous clashes recoded in neighboring municipalities (coded separately). 6 fatalities.

The clash extended to the vicinity of the communities of Vicente Guerrero and Andres Quintana Roo, about seven kilometers from the initial point. Authorities arrested 11 people involved, including three inmates and eight members of Pueblos Unidos.

source: El Blog del Narco; El Siglo de Durango; Quadratin Oaxaca; La Silla Rota
notes: On 16 October 2021, in Zamora de Hidalgo, Michoacan, members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) shot at the municipal police during a police patrol in Colonia Revolucion and Avenida ferrocarril. Three to two police officers were injured.

On 16 October 2021, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, there was an armed clash between two armed people and the municipal police after the individuals did not stop during a police control in Colonia San Pablo. A man and a woman were arrested. Allegedly, one person was injured but this was not confirmed by the authorities.

On 16 October 2021, in Zamora de Hidalgo, Michoacan, there was an armed clash between the municipal police and armed men during a police patrol in Colonia Nezahualcoyotl. Three police officers were injured and commander was killed. Three people were arrested. 1 fatality.

On 16 October 2021, in Tijuana, Baja California, there was an armed clash between the municipal police and armed men in a car after at least three armed men started shooting at the police in a drive-by shooting in Fraccionamiento Santa Fe tercera seccion. Two men were arrested. There were no casualties.

On 16 October 2021, in Irapuato, Guanajuato, there was an armed clash between several armed men on motorcycles during a funeral around Colonias Las Carmelitas and Floresta (drive-by). Three people were injured. One minor was killed with a stray bullet. 1 fatality.
On 16 October 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Venustiano Carranza, two alleged drug dealers were shot and killed by armed men in Colonia Morelos in the Tepito area. 2 fatalities.

actor2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police
source: Diario Contra Poder en Chiapas; Diario de Morelos
notes: On 16 October 2021, in Mazatepec municipality, Morelos, a criminal investigation police (ministerial police) was shot and killed while driving on the Alpuyeca-Grutas de Cacahuamilpa federal highway by armed men in a car in a drive-by shooting in Colonia Justo Sierra. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
notes: On 15 October 2021, in Esperanza, Sonora, there was an armed clash among armed men against the state police and military forces during a police patrol in Colonia centro. There was a car chase. Two armed men were killed. One man was arrested. 2 fatalities.

source: Borderland Beat; El Norte; La Prensa de Monclova; Milenio
notes: On 15 October 2021, in Doctor Coss municipality, Nuevo Leon, there was an armed clash between the Gulf cartel and the Cartel del Noreste on the Pena Blanca-Ciudad Camargo highway. Between 2-4 people were killed and found burned. At least 2 fatalities.
On 15 October 2021, in Frontera Comalapa municipality, Chiapas, there was an alleged armed clash between criminal groups in Chamic community. Casualties unknown.

actor2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Prison Guards
source: El Siglo de Durango; Milenio; Hoy Tamaulipas
notes: On 14 October 2021, in Ciudad de Villa de Alvarez, Colima, the director of the Center for Social Reintegration (Cereso) (prison guard) in Colima was shot and killed by unidentified armed men who entered his house in Colonia Villa Flores 2. His wife was also injured. His bodyguard was also shot and killed after he fired back. One of the perpetrators was also killed. 3 fatalities.

source: La Voz de Michoacan; MiMorelia; El Siglo de Durango
notes: On 14 October 2021, in Zamora de Hidalgo, Michoacan, a municipal police officer was shot and killed and another two police were injured after armed men shot at them during a police patrol in Colonia La Libertad. 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police
notes: On 13 October 2021, in Rioverde, San Luis Potosi, a ministerial police officer was shot and killed during an armed clash in Colonia Victoria. There is no information on the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

On 13 October 2021, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, a man was shot and killed and another one was injured in the Central Market. There are two versions of the event. One is that it happed as the result of an armed clash between several armed men. The second version is that both men were in a street food business where one was the owner and armed men shot at them. The authorities are investigating the event. 1 fatality.

On 13 October 2021, in Temixco, Morelos, a member of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) was shot and injured by several armed men of an alleged rival criminal group outside a bar in Colonia Ruben Jaramillo.
On 11 October 2021, in Uruapan, Michoacan de Ocampo, a shoot-out took place between armed rival groups, resulting in the death of one man. 1 fatality.

actor2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
notes: On 11 October 2021, in Irapuato, Guanajuato, a man and a woman were shot and killed in Colonia Malvas. The victims were a female state police officer and a former municipal police officer. The victims were executed with a shot to the head. 2 fatalities.

On 10 October 2021, in the municipality of Guadalupe y Calvo, Chihuahua, a clash between factions of the Sinaloa Cartel was reported, leaving at least 18 people dead. The clash occurred in the area is known as the 'Golden Triangle' and is controlled by the Sinaloa Cartel for the cultivation of poppy and marihuana. At leas 18 fatalities.

actor2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police; Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard
notes: On 10 October 2021, in Acambaro, Guanajuato, armed individuals and security forces, including the National Guard, state and ministerial police officers, engaged in a clash. Two former police officers were arrested by the security forces. One local police vehicle that was being used by the armed men was seized. One man was injured.
On 10 October 2021, in Playa del Carmen, Quintana Roo, a couple of armed men arrived at an intersection and opened fire at a tourist policeman, killing him. 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
notes: On 10 October 2021, close to Villa de Cos, Zacatecas, armed individuals engaged in a shoot-out against military and state forces near Santo Domingo. One officer and one was suspect died in the shoot-out. After the clash, officers freed 16 people who were kidnapped and arrested three suspects. Officers seized weapons and 43 vehicles. 2 fatalities.

On 10 October 2021, in Chihuahua, Chihuahua, municipal police officers fired at three armed individuals in Granjas Cerro Grande. It is unclear whether the armed individuals assaulted a police officer or were shot by police officers. There were no fatalities.

actor2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
notes: On 10 October 2021, close to Asientos, Aguascalientes, state police engaged in a shoot-out with armed individuals who kidnapped a man on the highway 107 to Emancipacion. The kidnapped man was rescued.

actor2: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police
notes: On 9 October 2021, in Tijuana, Baja California, three armed individuals shot at ministerial police during an operation in the area close to Pueblo Amigo Hotel. One officer was injured and transported to the hospital. 1 injury.
Around 9 October 2021 (weekend of), in Tepalcatepec, Michoacan de Ocampo, CJNG and an armed group from Jalisco engaged in a shoot-out to gain control over territory. Casualties unknown.

On 8 October 2021, close to Ciudad Acuna, Coahuila de Zaragoza, police officers engaged in a shoot-out with two armed individuals on the Acuna-Presa La Amistad highway. One perpetrator was killed in the shoot-out. 1 fatality.

On 8 October 2021, in Caleras de Amexhe, Guanajuato, military officers and armed men engaged in a shoot-out on the street 5 de febrero when military officers were carrying out an operation. Three perpetrators were killed and five were arrested. Seven vehicles and weapons were seized. 3 fatalities.

On 7 October 2021, close to Valle Hermoso, Tamaulipas, at least three armed individuals engaged in a shoot-out with military officers on the highway that connects El Empale with Valle Hermosos at KM 74. The perpetrators fled the scene and officers confiscated weapons, bulletproof vests and tactical equipment. There were no casualties.

On 7 October 2021, in Tijuana, Baja California, three armed men opened fire and shot a home in fraccionamiento Paseos del Vergel. According to unconfirmed reports, a person fired back. The house and the neighboring house were damaged. Casualties unknown.

On 5 October 2021, in Tlalpujahua municipality, Michoacan (coded to Tlalpujahua de Rayon), armed men shot at the base of the Traffic Police on the Maravatio-Tlalpujahua highway around Santa Maria community. The police shot back. Three police officers were killed and another two were also injured. A taxi driver was also killed. 4 fatalities.
On 5 October 2021, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, armed men in a car shot at a municipal police officer in a drive-by shooting in Colonia San isidro. 1 fatality.

On 5 October 2021, in Cosio, Aguascalientes, armed men shot at the municipal police after they did not stopped at a police checking point. One police officer was killed and another one was injured. 1 fatality.
